result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:36 PM
ADA Nicholas Bolz - present.
Attorney Nicole Masnica - present via zoom.
Defendant - present via zoom
Statements by the Court.
Statements by Atty. Masnica.
Statements by ADA Bolz.
Further statements by Atty. Masnica.
Statements by the Court.
The Court will leave current bond in place, with the following condition modification:
 - amended to permit possession and use of Chromebook provided by the Little Wolf School District. Said Chromebook is not to be utilized for access to the internet unless required by the School District as part of a class requirement. The defendant and parents shall execute a release authorizing the school district to release to the Waupaca County District Attorney's  office, reports of all Chromebook usage and educational progress.
STC: 9/26/2022 at 10:00am with 1970.
Bond continued.

**AMENDED 8/22/2022 to include the following condition:
-amended to permit possession and use of Chromebook provided by the Little Wolf School District. Said Chromebook is not to be utilized for access to the internet unless requited by the School District as part of a class requirement. The defendant and parents shall execute a release authorizing the school district to release to the Waupaca County District Attorney's  office, reports of all Chromebook usage and educational progress.
All other conditions remain.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:28 AM
ADA Bolz - present.
Attorney Nicole Masnica - present via Zoom.
Defendant - present via Zoom.
PQW filed with the Court.
Def. wishes to waive right to PH.
Court questions def. and advises of rights.
Complaint received.
Court finds def. waives his right to a PH, finds probable cause exists, and binds matter over to 1970 for ARGN.
Proceed to ARGN today.
Information to be filed, mirroring complaint.
Waive receipt and reading of information.
NG plea entered.
Court accepts NG plea.
STC 9/26/2022 at 10:00am with 1970.
Stmts by Atty. Masnica re: bond modification.
Stmts by ADA Bolz - State objects to bond modification at this time.
At this time the Court leaves current bond in place.
BBH: 8/22/2022 at 3:30pm with 1970.
The Court needs School plan at the Aug. 22, 2022 BBH.
Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter to the Court Re; Adjournment
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
